title.narrative: CONECEL L. Montesino Cell Phone. L Montesino vacant landline phone bill 99403. INCLE Funds for the CY19 Judiicial Stud in Pto Ric. Gas 2020 operational Lease Montesino Quito. PSC PR8038657 Ecuador Information Redacted NEW AWARD. Special Contracts for Research, Development and Others - Contractual Translation and Interpreting Services. 1930.0-L-1-1-PR7675715-INL INTERPRETER SERVICES. Value Added Taxes (VAT). L Montesino residence electricity FY2019. 1930.0-L-1-1-PR8378850-INL Transportation Machala

description.narrative: This award strives to help foreign partners professionalize their military forces through educational programs and technical support, ensuring that their force can develop and maintain the requisite capacity to effectively carry out its military mission through reliance on discipline, accountability, effective professional standards, and technical expertise. More specifically, this includes CONECEL L. Montesino Cell Phone [Covers the costs for local and long distance calls based on a rate-per-call basis or on the number of minutes of use under the FTS system.]. Covers the costs for local and long distance calls based on a rate-per-call basis or on the number of minutes of use under the FTS system.. INCLE Funds for the CY19 Judiicial Stud in Pto Rico[Covers services supplied by other U.S. Government agencies not otherwise classified.]. Covers transportation of property, household, and personal effects for employees, staff, volunteers, trainees, and dependents. Excludes domestic storage of staff household effects during assignment abroad.. From: Copeland, Tierra L <CopelandTL@state.gov> Sent: Thursday, September 3, 2020 2:44 PM To: Luchessi, Edward P (Quito) <LuchessiEP@state.gov>; Montesino, Leandro L (Quito) < Information Redacted Cc: Information Redacted , Ory S (Quito) < Information Redacted OS@state.gov>;. Leo Information Redacted FY2020 FOB [Covers rental and maintenance costs of computer software and related systems as well as the cost for the necessary infrastructure (i.e., servers. contractor staff, help desk, etc.) that allows Department of State employees to telework.]. Water - Operational Lease Montesino- Quito [Covers costs of purchased utilities, i.e., purchase of water, gas, electricity (light and power), sewage, garbage and trash disposal, and metered hot water heating.]. Electricity - Montesino FY20 - Quito [Covers costs of purchased utilities, i.e., purchase of water, gas, electricity (light and power), sewage, garbage and trash disposal, and metered hot water heating.]. CONECEL L. Montesino Cell Phone FY2020 [Covers the costs for local and long distance calls based on a rate-per-call basis or on the number of minutes of use under the FTS system.]. This has the same coverage as above, but covers household items. It would include ranges, refrigerators, washers, dryers, ironers, freezers, window-type air-conditioners for residential properties, transformers and voltage regulators for appliances, as well as living room, dining room, and bedroom suites; rugs, draperies, lamps; and fabric for furniture reupholstering. Special Purpose Equipment Covers the costs of special purpose equipment.. Covers the costs of rents or leases of real property with or without option to purchase, including land, structures, and improvements, as well as fixed equipment and furnishings when included in the price. Also includes landlord charges for services such as porterage and separate maintenance costs.. Gas 2020 operational Lease Montesino Quito [Covers costs of purchased utilities, i.e., purchase of water, gas, electricity (light and power), sewage, garbage and trash disposal, and metered hot water heating.]. Covers contractual services of educators and translators when they furnish their own supplies and equipment.. 1930.0-L-1/1-PR7675715-INL INTERPRETER SERVICES [Covers contractual services of educators and translators when they furnish their own supplies and equipment.]. Covers payments of reimbursable value added taxes on purchases as required, e.g., in European Common Market countries.. Covers costs of purchased utilities, i.e., purchase of water, gas, electricity (light and power), sewage, garbage and trash disposal, and metered hot water heating.. L Montesino vacant landline phone bill 99403 [Covers the costs for local and long distance calls based on a rate-per-call basis or on the number of minutes of use under the FTS system.]. Covers the purchases of IT equipment including central processing units (CPUs) and related systems equipment, and costs of initial installation of equipment when performed under contract.. L Montesino residence electricity FY2019 [Covers costs of purchased utilities, i.e., purchase of water, gas, electricity (light and power), sewage, garbage and trash disposal, and metered hot water heating.].

Through educational programs and technical support, help foreign partners professionalize their military forces, ensuring that their force can develop and maintain the requisite capacity to effectively carry out its military mission through reliance on discipline, accountability, effective professional standards, and technical expertise. In addition, activities assist foreign partners so that their military forces reliably demonstrate consistent support for adherence to norms of human rights; support the concept of civilian executive authority/control of the military; and have the capacity for institutional and security sector reform.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Bureau of International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: In response to restrictions imposed by the Ecuadorian government, USAID closed its mission on September 30, 2014. Additionally, International Military Education and Training (IMET) and Foreign Military Financing (FMF) assistance halted and remaining funds were reallocated when the Ecuadorian government terminated bilateral military cooperation and asked the U.S. Embassy to end military cooperation operations by April 30, 2014. The United States will continue to promote the development of sustainable institutions and processes in Ecuador for democracy, human rights, and the rule of law. U.S. assistance will support civil society and freedom of expression in Ecuador.
Amendment - BILATERAL & LETTERS OF AGREEMENTS - NON BULK OBLIGATIONS
